content:
Hello libs folks!

I included ops::ControlFlow in my try RFC. While it did get a "looks plausible" a while ago, it's gone through a few changes since then which might not have had libs eyes on it (just me and compiler people), notably changing from ControlFlow<C, B> to ControlFlow<B, C = ()> in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76614.

I have a few sections about why it's the way it is starting from https://github.com/scottmcm/rfcs/blob/do-or-do-not/text/0000-try-trait-v2.md#why-controlflow-pulls-its-weight

If you have any thoughts about changes, or other things you'd like to see in the RFC about it, please let me know!
The new RFC text is really nice to follow! I nominated for some synchronous discussion so we can see if we're comfortable with the system and figure out what a path to stabilization would look like

Thanks! I'm glad the rewrite helped.

I don't know how you normally do your meetings, but let me know if you'd like me to try to join to be there to answer questions if needed.
